poem.title: Daphne and Apollo
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Buonaparte got from his brother-in-law A Louvre load of statuary. Who was it took my daughters' shades and adolescent finery? - the cameras, CD players, music, phone, passports and holiday cash, The Dante, Milton, Joyce; Two weeks pay at least gone down With shares in children's memories While we were in the Villa Borghese As the god caught up with her And the look on their face as the lymph in her took hold And the laurel tree consumed her And Napoleon's sister sat next door.
